name: It Smells Like a Banquet in Here
description: 11 x 8 1/2" broadside. Letterpress printed on repurposed pink cardstock in three colors using wood and metal type, this work of microfiction is narrated by a caterer at a gothically comic child's birthday party.

name: Toy Story
description: 6 1/4 x 14 1/2" broadside. 'Toy Story' is printed in varied combinations of black & white on three different primary-colored hanging folders. It features a pattern of googly eyes and rolling O's as it tells the story of two classic toys exchanging barbs in their break room.

name: What Long Legs Mean [with Roxane Gay]
description: 11 1/2 x 9 1/2" broadside. This piece features a short story by Roxane Gay exploring a complex web of themes including attraction, intergenerational tension, and the erotic hate that shadows love. Signed by the author, it was made on the occasion of her 2013 Mission Creek Festival reading. It was printed in three colors on repurposed file folders and includes collaged cardstock elements.

name: The Onion's Tale
description: 8 x 9 1/2" broadside. Letterpress printed in three colors on repurposed cardstock, this piece's title visually summons the medieval/mid-century humorist mashup of Monty Python. 'The Onion's Tale' features a contemporary grocery store experience, an apt topic for a compressed story, as it can induce a feeling of panic, a need to quickly gather the goods and head for the door. This feeling of alienation has become more acute with the rise of Whole Foods, who has perfected their décor to maximize lingering and lull its shoppers into serene states of incubation. This piece attempts to capture that tension between those who become absorbed in a store’s constipated aesthetic and those who prefer the mad dash.

name: Shifts
description: 12 x 6 1/2" broadside. Letterpress printed in two colors on repurposed file folders, this broadside features a short story that puts a goth, homoerotic spin on food service work. Its diptych format and split Lydian title pun on the term "split shifts", and its brown text printed on a lighter brown background conjures a greasy paper bag that is featured in the story's content.

name: I Am So Alone
description: 8 1/2 x 11" broadside. Letterpress printed on cardstock in three colors. Inspired by an April 2009 issue of Us Magazine featuring an interview with Lindsay Lohan, this short story and its presentation both recreate the planet inside the actress's head: pastel and infantile -- part of her tragedy, of course, is that she was a child star. This planet's surface is made of an unstable cobble of balloons and at its heart is a cherry pit. The text block is destabilized by varying the leading, pinks and whites are layered to create a soda-shop feel, and bits of punctuation suggest those waxy chips found in mint-chocolate chip ice cream.

name: If you ever feel like a ghost,
description: 5 x 8" broadside. Letterpress printed in brown ink on bristol board, this prose poem is presented minimally and zeroes in on a limousine-encased celebrity -- just one of many humans with an unhealthy relationship with our soot-covered planet.

name: A Living Document
description: 8 3/4 x 11 1/2" broadside. In what ways was Vanna White 'our nation's typographer'? What depths of the patriotic psyche did she reveal: what letter of what law, what letterform behind which sparkly box? Printed with movable type on repurposed textured folders, this broadside can be ordered either with its title in a recessed window or not.

options.name: Title not printed in recessed window

name: Animals
description: 8 x 11" broadside. This pieces uses a bubblegum palette to present a poem about a post-apocalyptic storybook landscape.

name: Heir
description: 9 x 14" broadside. This work of microfiction was printed in four colors on found manila envelopes that came complete with rust stains offset from each other's clasps. The story's narrator stalks her estranged uncle at a Salvation Army thrift store and pores over a collection of increasingly haunted objects until she encounters a strange old woman who may or may not be her grandmother's ghost.

name: Loud Advert in Chorus
description: 4 x 6" broadside. Letterpress printed in black ink on bristol board, this prose poem's words are ordered using an Oulipo-inspired constraint: the vowels maintain an A-E-I-O-U pattern and the poem ends with handset type inspired by the classic Pepsi logo.

name: RUNX TALES #3
description: In Matt Runkle’s latest minicomic, we follow Runx on a series of new adventures: a recount of two different sugar-daddy relationships; a tour of an otherworldly drugstore; an esoteric exploration of San Jose, CA; and an interview with author Jincy Willett. 8 x 11" magazine format. 32 pages. Letterpress cover with offset contents and a 4 -page full-color spread.
